intro: Erigeron asperugineus, commonly known as the roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving them a rough texture, and its flowers are usually pale blue to white in color. Erigeron asperugineus is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
